medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing severe abdominal pain this morning, was unable to tolerate oral intake, and attempted an enema with no relief. Pain worsened, prompting a visit to the ED. Denied fever and chills, but felt poorly over the past 10 days. Presented to the ED previously with hematemesis, hemoptysis, and left-sided abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Steroid-dependent Sjogren syndrome, Polychondritis, history of Mumps and Measles as a child, surgical history includes right groin abscess requiring incision and drainage.
